sen.j: 大久保 春野（おおくぼ はるの、弘化3年8月18日 (旧暦)（1846年10月8日） - 1915年1月26日）は、日本の大日本帝国陸軍軍人、華族。
sen.e: Haruno OKUBO (October 8, 1846 - January 26) was a military man of Imperial Japanese Army (IJA) and a peerage.
Haruno OKUBO (October 8, 1846 - January 26, 1915) was a military man of Imperial Japanese Army (IJA) and a peerage.
Haruno OKUBO (October 8, 1846 - January 26, 1915) was a military man of Imperial Japanese Army (IJA) and a peerage.

sen.j: 朝鮮駐剳軍、第3師団 (日本軍)、第6師団 (日本軍)等を歴任する。
sen.e: He successively worked for different military forces such as Chosen Chusatsu Gun (former Kankoku Chusatsu Gun, army stationed in Korea from the beginning of Russo-Japanese War), the 3rd Division of Army (Japanese Army), the 6th Division of Army (Japanese Army) and so on.

He successively worked in different military positions such as Chosen Chusatsu Gun (former Kankoku Chusatsu Gun, army stationed in Korea from the beginning of Russo-Japanese War), the 3rd Division of Army (Japanese Army), the 6th Division of Army (Japanese Army) and so on.
sen.cmt: military forcesはmilitary positionsの方が適切と思われます。
sen.e: He successively worked in different military positions such as Chosen Chusatsu Gun (former Kankoku Chusatsu Gun, army stationed in Korea from the beginning of Russo-Japanese War), the 3rd Division of Army (Japanese Army), the 6th Division of Army (Japanese Army) and so on.

sen.j: 階級は陸軍大将位階勲等金鵄勲章男爵。
sen.e: His rank was Army General, Ranks and Orders, the Order of the Golden Kite, Baron.
His rank was Army General, Ranks and Orders, the Order of the Golden Kite, Baron.
His rank was Army General, Ranks and Orders, the Order of the Golden Kite, Baron.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 大久保氏は古代孝昭天皇の子孫で、和邇部臣の流れにある。
sen.e: OKUBO Clan was a descendant of Emperor Kosho in ancient times, which means he was also descendant from Wanibenoomi.
OKUBO Clan was a descendant of Emperor Kosho in ancient times, which means he was also descendant from Wanibenoomi.
OKUBO Clan was a descendant of Emperor Kosho in ancient times, which means he was also descendant from Wanibenoomi.

sen.j: 古くは西尾氏を称していた。
sen.e: In the ancient times, his family called themselves NISHIO Clan.
In the ancient times, his family called themselves NISHIO Clan.
In the ancient times, his family called themselves NISHIO Clan.

sen.j: 相州小田原藩主大久保氏は同族。
sen.e: OKUBO Clan, a lord of Odawara Domain in Soshu, was in the same family.
OKUBO Clan, a lord of Odawara Domain in Soshu, was in the same family.
OKUBO Clan, a lord of Odawara Domain in Soshu, was in the same family.

sen.j: 大久保家は代々式内社である県社淡海国玉神社（静岡県磐田市）祠官家で、父の大久保忠尚もやはり宮司であった。
sen.e: The OKUBO Family was hereditarily succeeding the position of Shinto priest of Omikunitama Prefectural Shrine (Iwata City, Shizuoka Prefecture), one of Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) since the times of ancestors, so his father, Tadanao OKUBO, was also Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs).

The OKUBO Family was hereditarily succeeding the position of Shinto priest of Omikunitama Prefectural Shrine (Iwata City, Shizuoka Prefecture), one of Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) since the times of ancestors, so his father, Tadanao OKUBO, was also Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs).

The OKUBO Family was hereditarily succeeding the position of Shinto priest of Omikunitama Prefectural Shrine (Iwata City, Shizuoka Prefecture), one of Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) since the times of ancestors, so his father, Tadanao OKUBO, was also Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs).

sen.j: 春野は忠尚の長男として生まれ、遠州報国団として父と共に戊辰戦争に従軍する。
sen.e: Haruno was born as the first-born son of Tadanao, and departed for the front of Boshin War as a member of Enshu Hokoku-dan (a troop mainly consisted of priesthoods and wealthy farmers in Shizuoka Prefecture) along with his father.

Haruno was born as the first-born son of Tadanao, and departed to the front of Boshin War as a member of Enshu Hokoku-dan (a troop mainly consisted of priesthoods and wealthy farmers in Shizuoka Prefecture) along with his father.
sen.cmt: departed forはdeparted toの方が適切と思われます。
sen.e: Haruno was born as the first-born son of Tadanao, and departed to the front of Boshin War as a member of Enshu Hokoku-dan (a troop mainly consisted of priesthoods and wealthy farmers in Shizuoka Prefecture) along with his father.

sen.j: 維新後、明治3年（1870年）5月、大阪兵学校内幼年校生徒となる。
sen.e: In May, 1870 after Meiji Restoration, he entered the preparatory school of Osaka Military School.
In May, 1870 after Meiji Restoration, he entered the preparatory school of Osaka Military School.
In May, 1870 after Meiji Restoration, he entered the preparatory school of Osaka Military School.

sen.j: 同10月からフランスに留学し、1875年7月帰国。
sen.e: In October, he went to France for study, and returned in July.
In October, he went to France for study, and returned in July, 1875.
In October, he went to France for study, and returned in July, 1875.

sen.j: 陸軍省七等出仕に命ぜられる。
sen.e: He was appointed as Shusshi (supernumerary government official) in the 7th rank of Ministry of Army.
He was appointed as Shusshi (supernumerary government official) in the 7th rank of Ministry of Army.
He was appointed as Shusshi (supernumerary government official) in the 7th rank of Ministry of Army.

sen.j: 1887年4月、陸軍歩兵少佐に任官され陸軍省第2局第5課長、1879年1月、第2局第1課長に移り、同10月呼称変更となり人員局歩兵課長となる。
sen.e: In April, he was appointed as Infantry Army Major to be Chief of the 5th division in the 2nd office of Ministry of Army, and in January moved to the Chief of the 1st division in the 2nd office, and in October, to the Chief of the infantry division in the Personnel Office due to the modification in his position name.

In April,1887 he was appointed as Infantry Army Major to be Chief of the 5th division in the 2nd office of Ministry of Army, and in January, 1879 moved to the Chief of the 1st division in the 2nd office, and in October, to the Chief of the infantry division in the Personnel Office due to the modification in his position name.

In April,1887 he was appointed as Infantry Army Major to be Chief of the 5th division in the 2nd office of Ministry of Army, and in January, 1879 moved to the Chief of the 1st division in the 2nd office, and in October, to the Chief of the infantry division in the Personnel Office due to the modification in his position name.

sen.j: 1880年5月に熊本鎮台歩兵第14連隊大隊長となり、1882年12月、参謀本部 (日本)管西局員に移る。
sen.e: In May, he was appointed as Daitaicho (Chief of batallion) of the 14th Infantry Regiment of Shindai (garrison) in Kumamoto, and in December, moved to Kansei-kyoku (office that controlled west Japan) of Staff Headquarters.

In May, 1880 he was appointed as Daitaicho (Chief of battalion) of the 14th Infantry Regiment of Chindai (garrison) in Kumamoto, and in December, 1882 moved to Kansei-kyoku (office that controlled west Japan) of Staff Headquarters.
sen.cmt: 西暦を加筆しました。batallionはbattalionのスペルミス。ShindaiはChindaiの誤りです。
sen.e: In May, 1880 he was appointed as Daitaicho (Chief of battalion) of the 14th Infantry Regiment of Chindai (garrison) in Kumamoto, and in December, 1882 moved to Kansei-kyoku (office that controlled west Japan) of Staff Headquarters.

sen.j: 1885年、中佐に進み7月24日から参謀本部編纂課長兼第2局第3課長に就任する。
sen.e: There he moved on to Lieutenant Colonel, and on July 24, he was appointed as Chief of Compilation Division of Staff Headquarters and Chief of the 3rd division in the 2nd office of Staff Headquarters concurrently.

In 1885, there he moved on to Lieutenant Colonel, and on July 24, he was appointed as Chief of Compilation Division of Staff Headquarters and Chief of the 3rd division in the 2nd office of Staff Headquarters concurrently.

In 1885, there he moved on to Lieutenant Colonel, and on July 24, he was appointed as Chief of Compilation Division of Staff Headquarters and Chief of the 3rd division in the 2nd office of Staff Headquarters concurrently.

sen.j: 1886年3月19日、歩兵第12連隊長に移り、1889年、歩兵大佐に進級する。
sen.e: On March 19, he moved to the Chief of the 12th Infantry Regiment, and moved on to Infantry Army General in 1889.
On March 19, 1886 he moved to the Chief of the 12th Infantry Regiment, and moved on to Infantry Army General in 1889.
On March 19, 1886 he moved to the Chief of the 12th Infantry Regiment, and moved on to Infantry Army General in 1889.

sen.j: 1890年6月13日、茨木惟昭の後を受け陸軍戸山学校長に就き、1891年6月15日、陸軍士官学校 (日本)長に移る。
sen.e: On June 13, he assumed office as Principal of Toyama Military School in succession to Koreaki IBARAKI on June 15, 1891.
On June 13, 1890 he assumed office as Principal of Toyama Military School in succession to Koreaki IBARAKI on June 15, 1891.
On June 13, 1890 he assumed office as Principal of Toyama Military School in succession to Koreaki IBARAKI on June 15, 1891.

sen.j: 翌年11月24日、第2師団 (日本軍)参謀長に就任し、1894年には陸軍少将に任命され歩兵第7旅団長を補され、日清戦争に出征する。
sen.e: On November 24 in the following year, he assumed office as Chief Staff Officer of the 2nd division (Japanese Army), and he was appointed as Army Major General to be Chief of the 7th Infantry Brigade to depart for the front of Sino-Japanese War.

On November 24 in the following year, he assumed office as Chief Staff Officer of the 2nd division (Japanese Army), and in 1894 he was appointed as Army Major General to be Chief of the 7th Infantry Brigade to depart for the front of Sino-Japanese War.

On November 24 in the following year, he assumed office as Chief Staff Officer of the 2nd division (Japanese Army), and in 1894 he was appointed as Army Major General to be Chief of the 7th Infantry Brigade to depart for the front of Sino-Japanese War.

sen.j: 日清戦争では海城市方面守備隊司令官、鳳城市方面守備隊司令官を務め、続く台湾出兵に参加し1897年12月、近衛師団歩兵第1旅団長に就任する。
sen.e: In Sino-Japanese War, he served as Commandor of Garrison targetting the neighborhood of Kaijo City as well as Commandor of Garrison targetting the neighborhood of Hojo City, and took part in the Taiwan expedition that followed, and in December assued office as Chief of the 1st Infantry Brigade for Imperial Guard Division.

In Sino-Japanese War, he served as Commander of Garrison targeting the neighborhood of Kaijo City as well as Commander of Garrison targeting the neighborhood of Hojo City, and took part in the Taiwan expedition that followed, and in December, 1897 assumed office as Chief of the 1st Infantry Brigade for Imperial Guard Division.
sen.cmt: 西暦を加筆しました。assuedはassumedのスペルミスと思われる。CommandorはCommanderのスペルミス。targettingはtargetingのスペルミス。
sen.e: In Sino-Japanese War, he served as Commander of Garrison targeting the neighborhood of Kaijo City as well as Commander of Garrison targeting the neighborhood of Hojo City, and took part in the Taiwan expedition that followed, and in December, 1897 assumed office as Chief of the 1st Infantry Brigade for Imperial Guard Division.

sen.j: 1900年に陸軍中将に進級し教育総監（後の教育総監部本部長）を経て1902年5月5日、第6師団長に親補され、第2軍 (日本軍)隷下として日露戦争に従軍する。
sen.e: In, he advanced to Lieutenant General in rank, and after General Office Director of Education (later, Director of Educational General Directorial Division), on May 5, he was appointed as Chief of the 6th Division and took part in Russo-Japanese War under the 2nd Army (Japanese Army).

In 1900, he advanced to Lieutenant General in rank, and after serving as General Office Director of Education (later, Director of Educational General Directorial Division), on May 5, 1902 he was appointed as Chief of the 6th Division and took part in Russo-Japanese War under the 2nd Army (Japanese Army).
sen.cmt: 西暦を加筆しました。after以下はafter serving as とした方が文意がより明らかになると思われます。
sen.e: In 1900, he advanced to Lieutenant General in rank, and after serving as General Office Director of Education (later, Director of Educational General Directorial Division), on May 5, 1902 he was appointed as Chief of the 6th Division and took part in Russo-Japanese War under the 2nd Army (Japanese Army).

sen.j: 沙河会戦を経て第4軍 (日本軍)隷下に移り奉天会戦に参加する。
sen.e: After Battle of Saka, he took part in Battle of Mukden under the 4th Army (Japanese Army).
After Battle of Saka, he took part in Battle of Mukden under the 4th Army (Japanese Army).
After Battle of Saka, he took part in Battle of Mukden under the 4th Army (Japanese Army).

sen.j: 戦後、功により1906年4月1日、勲一等旭日大綬章及び功二級金鵄勲章を受章、同7月6日、第3師団長に移り、1907年9月21日、男爵を授けられ華族に列せられる。
sen.e: After the war, he received Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun as well as the Order of the Golden Kite in the 2nd class for his achievement on April 1, and on July 6 in the same year, he moved to the Chief of the 3rd Division, and on September 21, he was given the title of baron to rank with peerage.

After the war, he received Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun as well as the Order of the Golden Kite in the 2nd class for his achievement on April 1, 1906, and on July 6 in the same year, he moved to the Chief of the 3rd Division, and on September 21, 1907 he was given the title of baron to rank with peerage.

After the war, he received Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun as well as the Order of the Golden Kite in the 2nd class for his achievement on April 1, 1906, and on July 6 in the same year, he moved to the Chief of the 3rd Division, and on September 21, 1907 he was given the title of baron to rank with peerage.

sen.j: 1908年8月7日、陸軍大将に進み同12月から韓国駐剳軍司令官に就任する。
sen.e: On August 7, he moved on to Army General, and in December, he assumed office as Commandor of Kankoku Chusatsu-gun.
On August 7, 1908 he moved on to Army General, and in December, he assumed office as Commander of Kankoku Chusatsu-gun.
sen.cmt: 西暦を加筆しました。CommandorはCommanderのスペルミス。
sen.e: On August 7, 1908 he moved on to Army General, and in December, he assumed office as Commander of Kankoku Chusatsu-gun.

sen.j: 1910年10月、先の韓国併合に伴い呼称変更され朝鮮駐剳軍司令官。
sen.e: In October, the position name changed to Commandor of Chosen Chusatsu-gun due to the annexation of Korea.
In October, 1910 the position name changed to Commander of Chosen Chusatsu-gun due to the annexation of Korea.
sen.cmt: 西暦を加筆しました。CommandorはCommanderのスペルミス。
sen.e: In October, 1910 the position name changed to Commander of Chosen Chusatsu-gun due to the annexation of Korea.
October 18, reserve duty.
On October 18, 1911 reserve duty.
On October 18, 1911 reserve duty.

sen.j: 1915年（大正4年）1月26日薨去。
sen.e: January 26, 1915, passed away.
On January 26, 1915, passed away.
On January 26, 1915, passed away.

sen.j: 特旨により従二位に叙される。
sen.e: Given the Junii (Junior Second Rank) after a special consideration.
Given the Junii (Junior Second Rank) after a special consideration.
Given the Junii (Junior Second Rank) after a special consideration.

sen.j: 娘婿 金井延（東京大学教授・初代経済学部長）、一戸寛（陸軍少佐・黒羽藩大関増徳六男・陸軍大将一戸兵衛嫡養子）
sen.e: His sons-in-law were Noburu KANAI (Professor of Tokyo University, the 1st Dean of Faculty of Economics) and Hiroshi ICHINOHE (the 6th-born son of Major of Army Masuyoshi OSEKI in Kurobane Domain, an adopted son of Army General, Hyoe ICHINOHE).

His sons-in-law were Noburu KANAI (Professor of Tokyo University, the 1st Dean of Faculty of Economics) and Hiroshi ICHINOHE (the 6th-born son of Major of Army Masuyoshi OSEKI in Kurobane Domain, an adopted son of Army General, Hyoe ICHINOHE).

His sons-in-law were Noburu KANAI (Professor of Tokyo University, the 1st Dean of Faculty of Economics) and Hiroshi ICHINOHE (the 6th-born son of Major of Army Masuyoshi OSEKI in Kurobane Domain, an adopted son of Army General, Hyoe ICHINOHE).
